name: biomni-extract-pdf-content
title: Biomni: Extract PDF Content
description: Extract text content from a PDF file given its URL. Automatically handles both direct PDF URLs and web pages containing PDF links.
content:
Overview

Extract text content from PDF research papers and documents given their URL. This tool automatically handles both direct PDF URLs and web pages containing PDF links, making it easy to access full-text content from published literature.

Input Parameters

  • url (required): URL pointing to a PDF file or a webpage containing a PDF link

Biological Use Case

Essential for extracting full-text content from scientific publications for downstream analysis. Use cases include: extracting methods sections from published papers, gathering supplementary data descriptions, mining literature for specific experimental protocols, building text corpora for meta-analyses, and enabling text-based searches within PDFs. Particularly useful when working with papers from journals, preprint servers, or institutional repositories where PDFs are the primary format.

Output

Returns a text file (pdf_content.txt) containing the extracted text content from the PDF, maintaining the original document structure and formatting where possible. The text can be used for further analysis, searching, or data extraction.

Category

literature
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/literature/extract_pdf_content.py --url "${url}" -o "${outputDir}"
